sentences.en: But their work appears to merge in the study of large eddies.
sentences.cn: 但在大旋涡的研究上,他们的工作看来却殊途同归.

sentences.en: He sent every member of staff a mail-merge letter wishing them a merry Christmas!
sentences.cn: 他给所有员工群发了一封信，祝大家圣诞快乐！

sentences.en: I can merge my two small businesses into a large one.
sentences.cn: 我可以将我的两家小商店合并为一家大商行.

sentences.en: Many companies merge and few demerge.
sentences.cn: 有很多公司合并，而分立的却很少。

sentences.en: Night and day begin to merge.
One end is blue, one end is red, and the colors merge in the middle.
sentences.cn: 一端为蓝色, 一端为红色, 这两种颜色在中间混成一色.

sentences.en: One end is blue, one end is red, and the colours merge in the middle.
sentences.cn: 一端为蓝色, 一端为红色; 这两种颜色在中间混为一色.

sentences.en: Please merge all these items together under the item of " incidental expenses ".
sentences.cn: 把这些费用归并列入 “ 杂费 ” 项内.

sentences.en: Some militant leaders want to merge with white radicals.
sentences.cn: 一些好斗的领导人要和白人中的激进派联合.

sentences.en: The banks are set to merge next year.
sentences.cn: 这几家银行准备明年合并。

sentences.en: The company plans to merge its subsidiaries in the US.
sentences.cn: 该公司计划合并其在美国的几家子公司。

sentences.en: The directors have decided to merge the two small firms together.
sentences.cn: 董事们已决定把这两家小商号归并起来.

sentences.en: The roads merge a kilometre ahead.
sentences.cn: 这两条道路在前面一公处汇合成一条大道.

sentences.en: The sky and the water seem to merge.
The two lanes merge going into the tunnel.
sentences.cn: 两条车道会合后引入隧道.

sentences.en: The two roads merge a mile ahead.
sentences.cn: 两条路在前面一英里处会合.

words.tran_cn: （企业等的）合并；并购；吸收（如刑法中重罪吸收轻罪）

phrases.tran_cn: 融入（车流中）；与…结合；于…联合

trans.tran_en: to combine, or to join things together to form one thing

trans.tran_cn: （使）混合，相融，融入，渐渐消失在某物中

trans.tran_en: to combine, or to join things together to form one thing
